content: This document contains the text of the Foreign Investment Risk Review Modernization Act of 2018. The act broadens the scope of transactions subject to review by the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) to include certain non-controlling investments and real estate transactions. The act also expands CFIUS's authority to review transactions that may present national security risks, and creates a new process for expediting review of certain transactions. The act includes provisions for judicial review and protection of sensitive information. Additionally, the act includes provisions on transition, relationship to other laws, miscellaneous provisions, severability, and authorization of appropriations.
